activities:
1.  Human resources data:  for staffing and management
2.  Pharmacovigilence data: required for regulatory recordkeeping and reporting, e.g., names, addresses, contact information of veterinarians, their clinic staff, pet owners, and farmers; also, for individuals who contact NAH after they are exposed to or injest NAH products
3. Clinical trial data for studies and regulatory purposes - e.g., names of pet owners
contactoff1: Novartis Animal Health US, Inc. Privacy Office
corpofftitle1: VP, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: The recourse mechanism chosen for the resolution of disputes involving EU Data is the EU  Protection Authorities (EU DPAs); and for dispute resolution involving Switzerland, the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC) is the chosen mechanism.
